data.title: Delivery may be the way to go maybe
data.text:
My first Munchies pizza.  I've been having delivery lately so I can only rate staff by the delivery person and time it took to get here. All in all I'd have to rate it a 5. Thre ads say lots of Cheese, but I'd disagree. A lot of cheese is when you have a huge problem eating it for the first 2 pieces or so.  This pie had mediocre amount and didn't "pull" even with the first piece.
 Delivery came within 30 minutes.   The delivery person was friendly and put a smile on. He said to hang on to the order ticket because after 7 pies you get a free one. Also a free drink with an online coupon. That I did mention I already had but guess the person taking the order didn't hear that. You get a free small order of cheese sticks with a 14" or 16". Those were good..... 
 Will I save 7 tickets to get a free one?   At 21$ for a pepperoni, mushroom, onion, and black olive, so so pizza? Doubtful. But I won't say terrible. The sauce was OK.!

data.title: Small but friendly pizza place downtown
data.text: I love pizza and this place has good pizza.  Best yet, every time you buy pizza, you get some of their signature bread included.

data.title: Gluten Free Pizza
data.text: While Muncheez did not have the best gluten free pizza I have ever had, they were fast, easy, nice, and flexible. A lot of pizza places do not let you do substitutions on gluten free pizza or only have select options for gluten free pizza. Muncheez can make almost any of their pizzas gluten free and they were willing to add or subtract toppings without any hassle. They are also open late night, which is always nice if you get the midnight munchies. They do not have a soda fountain, but they do have canned and bottled beverages. They have a seating area, but it is limited. They do deliver. They also sell select alcohol and have discounted drink hours. Their located right downtown which makes them convenient if you are spending some time downtown and want to grab a bite to eat.

data.title: Great pizza; environment not for everyone though
data.text: Heard about how good this was from others and of the awards their pizza won so wanted to give it a try. It certainly didn't disappoint. Pizza was amazing. Loved the teriyaki chicken pizza. Their hand tossed pizzas have very good crust. Prices were very reasonable, especially when they throw in the large plate of cheesy bread-sticks with the larger pizza orders absolutely free. My only minor annoyances was that the waitress disappeared in the back upon us asking her to give us a moment to decide upon our order and took forever to return and also just of the size of the place with minimal seating. Thankfully we were there when it was dead but I hate to imagine what it would be like during a busy time. Some may also like it's lounge type atmosphere with a television screen projected on the wall which gives it a unique laid-back atmosphere. I however prefer the wait staff coming to our table to take our orders and not having to put in our order at the checkout but if you don't mind that then this is for you.

data.title: Yuck
data.text: Don't waste your money.  The pizza was cold upon delivery and had some weird spice thrown all over the top of it.  Gross...

data.title: After Bar Heaven!
data.text: Good Za - on a budget. Open late - small dining area...not good for groups. Friendly staff - yes we will be back!

data.title: VERY Impressed - Give this Place a Try!
data.text: We had lunch here as part of a day trip to Appleton. We decided to try it as part of a Groupon offer so I didn't do much research ahead of time. It is a small place but the food and employees make it worth patronizing this business. The pizza was fabulous and the salad was by far the best I've ever had (not exaggerating). The prices were reasonable and the place was clean. We'll be returning for sure!

data.title: Awesome place and best pizza in appleton
data.text: The place is awesome.  Pizza is the best in appleton, and good deal for the money.  Free delivery.  Staff has always been good.  The building itself is pretty sweet if you're looking to go there rather than delivery.  If I stay the night in appleton, this is usually what I do.  If you got the muncheez give them a call.

data.title: Good for Carryout
data.text:
My coworkers and I have ordered Muncheez for lunch a few times. This last time, I decided to pick up a pizza for supper for my family. The pizza is pretty good.  To me, their seems pretty fresh and I especially like the sausage on their pizza. The hand-tossed crust is just the right thickness. The sauce has just a hint of sweetness whichis something different. Also, they through in a very generous order of fairly decent cheesy bread with every 14" or bigger pizza.

I've never eaten in the restaurant, but it definitely seems to be a VERY relaxed atmosphere. Dilated pupil relaxed, maybe. But for carryout, it is a good pie.  Be sure to look online for coupons and, if a one topping is all you need, get the carryout special. $13 out the door for a 16" with cheesy bread...great deal!

data.title: Stoner Staff
data.text: I would like to rate this place higher but when it comes to staff...pft how about not? it looks run down in the place plus when I called after eating my pizza to compliment how good it was he was soooo overrrrr the top rude I can tell he was stoned as almost all the younger staff...how typical stoners working at a place called muncheez -_- might not come here again the prices were a little to much.

data.title: There are better places to eat
data.text: I like to go to pizza places in Appleton area because there often the best I always look for the small hole in the wall places so I stopped here the pizza tasted just like a frozen like a jacks I won't eat there again

data.title: Yummy
data.text: I have had Muncheez many times, alwaysed delivered and when I have had lots of people in the Appleton area and it has always been a crowd pleaser.  What I ordered, hot and friendly staff.

data.title: Average Pizza
data.text: I have eaten Muncheez pizza twice and it is good but nothing spectacular. The prices are a little above average for the quality. I would just as soon go to Papa Murphy's and get a family size for twelve dollars or wait until Papa John's or Pizza Hut are running specials.
